__comment: THIS FILE WAS AUTO-GENERATED USING https://github.com/revoltchat/api. DO NOT EDIT.

info.title: Revolt API
info.description:
User-first privacy focused chat platform built with modern web technologies.

# Authentication

Currently all relevant requests are authenticated by the use of two headers which identify a session.

<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Core
tags.description: Use in your applications to determine information about the Revolt node.

tags.name: Onboarding
tags.description: After signing up to Revolt, users must pick a unique username.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Manage your account.

tags.name: Session
tags.description: Create and manage sessions.

tags.name: User Information
tags.description: Query and fetch users on Revolt

tags.name: Direct Messaging
tags.description: Direct message other users on Revolt

tags.name: Relationships
tags.description: Manage your friendships and block list on the platform

tags.name: Channel Information
tags.description: Query and fetch channels on Revolt

tags.name: Channel Invites
tags.description: Create and manage invites for channels

tags.name: Channel Permissions
tags.description: Manage permissions for channels

tags.name: Messaging
tags.description: Send and manipulate messages

tags.name: Groups
tags.description: Create, invite users and manipulate groups

tags.name: Voice
tags.description: Join and talk with other users

tags.name: Server Information
tags.description: Query and fetch servers on Revolt

tags.name: Server Members
tags.description: Find and edit server members

tags.name: Server Permissions
tags.description: Manage permissions for servers

tags.name: Bots
tags.description: Create and edit bots.

tags.name: Invites
tags.description: View, join and delete invites

tags.name: Sync
tags.description: Upload and retrieve any JSON data between clients

tags.name: Web Push
tags.description: Subscribe to and receive Revolt push notifications while offline

get.description: This returns information about which features are enabled on the remote node.
This will tell you whether the current account requires onboarding or whether you can continue to send requests as usual. You may skip calling this if you're restoring an existing session.

post.description: This sets a new username, completes onboarding and allows a user to start using Revolt.

username.description: An alphanumeric username which is used to identify the user on the platform.

post.description: Create a new account.
Resend account creation verification email.
Verifies an email with code.
Send password reset email.
Login to an account.
Close current session.

parameters.name: revoke_self
parameters.description: Whether to revoke current session too.

content.description: Text to set as user profile description

remove.description: Field to remove from user object

get.description: This returns a default avatar based on the given id.
Retrieve a list of mutual friends and servers with another user.

users.description: Array of user IDs who both you and the other user are friends with.

servers.description: Array of server IDs who both you and the other user are members of.

get.description: This fetches your direct messages, including any DM and group DM conversations.

recipients.description: List of user IDs who are participating in this DM

last_message_id.description: Id of the last message in this channel

recipients.description: List of user IDs who are participating in this group

owner.description: User ID of group owner

last_message_id.description: Id of the last message in this channel

nsfw.description: Whether this channel is marked as not safe for work

get.description: Open a DM with another user.
Fetch all of your relationships with other users.
Fetch your relationship with another other user.

put.description: Send a friend request to another user or accept another user's friend request.

200.description: Sent friend request / added user as friend.

delete.description: Denies another user's friend request or removes an existing friend.

200.description: Deleted friend request / removed user from friends.

nsfw.description: Whether this channel is not safe for work

remove.description: Field to remove from channel object

delete.description: Deletes a server channel, leaves a group or closes a DM.

post.description:
Creates an invite to this channel.

Channel must be a `TextChannel`.

put.description:
Sets permissions for the specified role in this channel.

Channel must be a `TextChannel` or `VoiceChannel`.

Sets permissions for the default role in this channel.

Channel must be a `Group`, `TextChannel` or `VoiceChannel`.

post.description: Sends a message to the given channel.

mention.description: Whether this reply should mention the message's author.

masquerade.description:
Masquerade displayed for a message.
Replaces user's name and avatar.

limit.description:
Maximum number of messages to fetch.

For fetching nearby messages, this is `(limit + 1)`.

before.description: Message id before which messages should be fetched.

after.description: Message id after which messages should be fetched.

nearby.description:
Message id to fetch around, this will ignore 'before', 'after' and 'sort' options.
Limits in each direction will be half of the specified limit.
It also fetches the specified message ID.

include_users.description: Whether to include user (and member, if server channel) objects.

200.description: Message array or object with requested data.

nonce.description:
Nonce value, prefer to use ULIDs here for better feature support.

Used to prevent double requests to create objects.

content.description: Message content, can be an object *only* if sent by the system user.

edited.description: Unix timestamp of when message was last edited

mentions.description: Array of user IDs mentioned in message

replies.description: Array of message IDs replied to

masquerade.description:
Masquerade displayed for a message.
Replaces user's name and avatar.

nonce.description:
Nonce value, prefer to use ULIDs here for better feature support.

Used to prevent double requests to create objects.

replies.description: Array of message IDs replied to

masquerade.description:

Replaces user's name and avatar.

relations.description:
Relationships with other known users
Only present if fetching self

badges.description:
Bitfield of user's badges

`1`: Developer
`2`: Translator
`4`: Supporter
`8`: Responsible Disclosure
`16`: Founder
`32`: Platform Moderation
`64`: Active Supporter
`128`: Paw
`256`: Early Adopter
`512`: Reserved Relevant Joke Badge 1

flags.description:
User flags

`1`: Account is suspended
`2`: Account was deleted
`4`: Account is banned

bot.description: Bot information, present if user is a bot.

owner.description: The User ID of the owner of this bot

patch.description: Edits a message that you've previously sent.

delete.description: Delete a message you've sent or one you have permission to delete.

post.description:
This route returns any changed message objects and tells you if any have been deleted.

Don't actually poll this route, instead use this to update your local database.

nonce.description:
Nonce value, prefer to use ULIDs here for better feature support.

Used to prevent double requests to create objects.

content.description: Message content, can be an object *only* if sent by the system user.

edited.description: Unix timestamp of when message was last edited

mentions.description: Array of user IDs mentioned in message

replies.description: Array of message IDs replied to

masquerade.description:
Masquerade displayed for a message.
Replaces user's name and avatar.

post.description: This route searches for messages within the given parameters.

query.description:
Full-text search query.

See [MongoDB documentation](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/text-search/#-text-operator) for more information.

limit.description: Maximum number of messages to fetch.

before.description: Message id before which messages should be fetched.

after.description: Message id after which messages should be fetched.

sort.description: Message sort direction, by default it will be sorted by relevance.

include_users.description: Whether to include user (and member, if server channel) objects.

post.description: Creates a new server role.

permissions.description: Tuple consisting of server and channel permissions in that order

remove.description: Field to remove from role object

colour.description:
Valid HTML colour

Warning: This is untrusted input, do not simply insert this anywhere.

**Example usage:**
```js
document.body.style.color = role.colour;
```

hoist.description: Whether to display this role separately on the members list

rank.description:
Role ranking

A role with a smaller number will have permissions over roles with larger numbers.

delete.description: Deletes a server role by ID.

post.description: Create a new Revolt bot.

_id.description:
Bot ID

This matches the bot's User ID.

owner.description: Bot owner's User ID

public.description: Whether the bot can be added by anyone

interactions_url.description:
Interactions endpoint URL

Required for dynamic interactions such as bot commands and message actions. Events will be sent over HTTP and a response may be generated directly.

post.description:
Fetch settings from server filtered by keys.

This will return an object with the requested keys, each value is a tuple of `(timestamp, value)`, the value is the previously uploaded data.
Upload data to save to settings.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of settings change. Useful to prevent a feedback loop.

post.description: Fetch information about unread state on channels.

Create a new Web Push subscription.

If an existing subscription exists on this session, it will be removed.
Remove the Web Push subscription associated with the current session.
